The that specifies the distinguished name for this application partition.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default object class that represents the application partition is domainDNS.

Docs.exception: A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.

The target in the parameter is not a server, or the parameter is not in a valid distinguished name format. This exception is also thrown if the application partition is being created within an Active Directory forest, rather than an AD LDS configuration set, because the can only be specified for AD LDS configuration sets.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DirectoryServers As DirectoryServerCollection

Docs.summary: Gets an object that contains the directory servers that host this application partition.
Docs.value: A object that contains objects that represent directory servers for this application partition.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition.DirectoryServers%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property returns the same collection of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer> objects as the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition.FindAllDirectoryServers?displayProperty=nameWithType> method if the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition> object has been committed to the underlying directory services store.

Docs.exception: The object has not yet been committed to the underlying directory store.
The object has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string distinguishedName);

.method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ApplicationPartition FindByName(class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string distinguishedName) cil managed
Public Shared Function FindByName (context As DirectoryContext, distinguishedName As String) As ApplicationPartition

Docs.param: A object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.
A that contains the distinguished name of the application partition to search for.
Docs.summary: Returns an object for a given object and distinguished name.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the results of the search.
Docs.exception:
This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:
- A target specified in the parameter could not be found.
- The target is a configuration set and no AD LDS instance was found in that configuration set.
- The target is a forest and the application partition was not found in that forest.
- The target does not host the current application partition.
- No AD LDS instance was found for the application partition.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
or is .

This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:
- The parameter is not a valid forest, configuration set, or directory server.
- The has a zero length.
- The parameter is in an invalid format.

Docs.summary: Retrieves a directory server for this application partition.
